intro: Miscopetalum, commonly known as the "milkweed of the Andes," is a genus of flowering plants native to South America. It belongs to the family Malvaceae, which includes hibiscus and cotton. The plants are characterized by their showy, often pink or purple flowers and hairy stems. They typically grow in high-altitude regions and are adapted to cool, moist climates. Miscopetalum species are also noted for their milky sap, which is a distinguishing feature of the genus.
